titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
Frederick C. O'Dell Papers, 1918-1919
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Leonard A. Coombs

did.abstract: Master engineer of 1st Battalion, 310th U.S. Army Engineers, in charge of the Army Topographical Office in Archangel, Russia during the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition." Collection includes maps, architectural drawings, photographs, and miscellanea relating to the work of the 310th Engineers in Russia. Architectural drawings include plans for buildings and fortifications.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Frederick C. O'Dell (donor no. 8900); a portion of the collection was transferred from the William L. Clements Library (donor 1333).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Frederick C. O'Dell Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Frederick C. O'Dell, Master Engineer, 1st Battalion, 310th Engineers, U.S. Army, was in charge of the Army Topographical Office in Archangel, Russia, during the American Expedition to North Russia, 1918-1919.

scopecontent.p: The collection relates entirely to O'Dell's experience serving with the American Expeditionary Force, North Russia, 1918-1919. The bulk of the collection consists of maps and architectural designs for buildings and fortifications constructed by the American Expeditionary Force, North Russia. Most of the maps and designs were produced by the 310th Engineers. In addition, there are two folders of photographs taken of the area and a scattering of miscellaneous official documents.

did.unittitle: Photographic views of Archangel and photos of barracks, stables, fortifications, and other structures built by the 310th Engineers
Photographic views of Archangel and photos of barracks, stables, fortifications, and other structures built by the 310th Engineers
Documents relating to assignments and memorabilia
Group portrait of 310th Engineers while in training at Camp Custer, Michigan

scopecontent.p: The Maps series includes general maps of the Archangel district at scales ranging from 1:420,000 to 1:20,000, large scale maps of cities and towns involved in military operations, reconnaissance and road maps, and maps of fortifications and military positions during the 1918-1919 campaign. Maps issued by the Allied Mapping Section and the Mapping Section, Dvina Force are noted in the contents list.

scopecontent.p: The Defensive Maps series consists of blueprint maps created by the 310th Engineers in North Russia. They were originally wired together in a folder marked Appendix No.4, Section 3. They have been left in O'Dell's original order. Items numbered 6A, 37A, and 64A were not on O'Dell's list. Item 61 on O'Dell's list was not found. The original introduction found in the folder has been placed in Folder 17.

scopecontent.p: The Architectural Design series consists of plans and designs of buildings and fortifications constructed by the 310th Engineers in North Russia. They were originally wired together in a folder marked Appendix No. 4, Section 2. They have been arranged by work number. The Original introduction found in the folder has been placed in Folder 17)
